fields.description:
I am trying to limit users access to the reporting screen ('find issues') as we do not want users to be able to monitor the projects as a whole. On the other hand we would like them to be able to monitor and add coments to issues that they have logged. I have tried limiting the 'browse project' permission but this seems to stop them looking at all issues including their own issues, even via the link on the email that they are sent?
is there a way around this?

cheers,
g

Some request can take up to 10 seconds pegging out the processor.

If I had to guess to what the problem is I would suggest it has something to do with the qrtz scheduler. In RC2 it never created the tables becuase of JRA-1312. I would think that the qrtz scheduler never started in RC2. However it did start in RC3.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status|borderStyle=solid}
To all JIRA users who have been watching this issue:
We have looked at this issue from every possible angle, banging our heads together, internally feuding and exploring various resourcing options. 
We have discussed it with customers at user conferences, in email, and during meetings at their offices.

*Ultimately, however, we have decided that we will not be implementing Field Level Security in JIRA.*

We have not made this call lightly, in fact, far from it. We have always maintained an earnest desire to deliver the goods and fix the problem properly. At the same time, if we had completed the request, we saw inherent issues would arise that would burden our developers, our customers, and the product.

The main reasons are as follows:
 * -JRA-1330- requires a significant rewrite of most major components and is akin to rebuilding JIRA from scratch.
 * The development time and effort required to achieve it would be massive (12/18 months +)
 * It would totally monopolise the engineering team and NO other features or reworks would be delivered during that period
 * The implementation would add considerable "bloat" to JIRA
 * JIRA admin would become far more complex
 * It may well add major performance overhead to the product

We've also made a number of attempts to break the feature into smaller useful chunks but these always seem extremely complex for little or no real value delivered. Whichever way we look at it we can't justify bringing all other development on JIRA to a halt for so long to provide this one feature.

In retrospect, we missed the opportunity to address this request and your comments properly earlier, and this response comes later than it should. For that, we sincerely apologise. We remain committed to being an open company, whether it's with regards to feature requests, pricing, or bugs in our software. We will strive to answer product management questions and feature requests sooner, frequently, publicly, and more decisively.

*Workarounds*
Higher in the thread Erik S makes a comment about a workaround that may be useful for some users:
[http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-1330?focusedCommentId=55032#action_55032]
it is documented further here:
[http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=149834]
Third party commercial plugin:
[https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/23216]

We are going to close this issue, mark it as "Won't Fix". Any further options that we uncover will be noted on this issue.

Regards
Brett Jackson
Atlassian Product Management

*For Cloud Users:*

Third-party commercial plugin:

[https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1226365/secure-custom-fields-for-jira-field-permission-security?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] 

Related Issue: 

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-69298 

 

{*}UPDATE{*}: We have reviewed this request again within the team and have had long conversations with our JIRA architect. This has lead to the conclusion that the original reasons for not implementing this feature still apply. We understand that this will disappoint a lot of users watching this JIRA issue, but as we are an open company we would rather be honest with you guys and let you all know now that we will not be implementing field level security. I understand many customers will want to discuss this further and they can do so by emailing me directly.

Cheers,
Roy Krishna
JIRA Product Management
roy at atlassian dot com
{panel}

The RSS XML sent from a filter includes the following in its link element:
<link>http://jira.jlcp.org/ViewIssue.jspa?key=JLCP-7</link>
It should be:
<link>http://jira.jlcp.org/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=JLCP-7</link>.  If you don't have the /secure/ in there, the page will be unstyled.

fields.description: When attempting to delete an issue link type, the number of existing links of that type is shown. It would be better if a link to those issues was provided as well. Even better would be the option to change the link type of those existing links (similar to when some other objects are deleted).
fields.summary: Show existing links when deleting link type

fields.description: Since the size of the table is not constant from page to page, it is impossible to quickly scroll forward and back without having to chase the links around the screen. If the forward/back links were on top of the context table, then they would always remain in the same location.
fields.summary: Move 'Previous / Next' links to top of page

fields.description: To support the ability to tell some "hey, have a look at this".
fields.summary: Mail an issue to a jira-user

fields.description:
Under the project summary on the right hand side of the screen there are topics that represent the number of issues associated with each topic type.

One in particular, Assigned, shows a count of all issues that have a value in the assigned field.  This also includes the issues that are assigned to unassigned.  

It would be nice to have an additional topic there that shows how many are unassigned.
fields.summary: Open issues summary enhancement

fields.description:
Assume that you have 300 results from a issue filter.  These 300 results are broken up onto pages.  Each page includes 20 results.  When clicking the Excel link to create an Excel spreadsheet from the results of the filter an Excel spreadsheet is returned with only 20 rows instead of all 300.  

It would be nice to be able to get a spreadsheet with all of the results and not just the ones currently being displayed.
fields.summary: Excel reports enhancement

fields.description: I spent a lot of time (and post-its) on issue numbers so that I can link things together.  It would be great to be able to browse for an issue in a pop-up.
fields.summary: Browse for issue identifiers (instead of having to remember them...)

fields.description:
The description under Administration/General Configuration/Options/Allow Unassigned Issues reads as follows.
"Allows issues to be assigned to 'noone' or unassigned. If turned off, issues will always be assigned to someone - when created they will be automatically assigned to the project lead who then passes them off."

Shouldnt 'noone' be 'none'.
fields.summary: 'noone' misspelled under configuration

fields.description:
When running starup.bat Jira tries to create qtz_job_details,
qtz_triggers and qtz_trigger_listeners but they fail because MySQL has a 500 character limit on it's tables primary key's.
fields.summary: MySQL "qtz_" tables 500 character primary key limit

fields.description:
Update the entitymodel definitions and code to user the id key instead of the string names as keys.  

This will prevent some database having problems with the maximum key length.
fields.summary: Quartz tables using composite keys

fields.description:
We noticed the "sent date" on emails is being reported as GMT +0000 but the
time is EST (which is what our server is set to).
fields.summary: Sent date on emails is incorrect

fields.description:
Some tasks take more than one admin screen to do, so provide a wizard based interface for it.

setup comment handler, requires:
- ensure pop server exists
- ensure pop service exists
- setup message handler

Make a wizard that makes it nicer for these things.
fields.summary: Create wizard-like interface for admin tasks

fields.description:
Hello,

we have found, that all usernames are turned to lower characters when they
are created. During logon they are handled case sensitive. Is this a bug or
a feature ? ;-)
fields.summary: Lowercased usernames are a bit confussing

Note we're using the standalone version.

fields.description:
Currently Tomcat starts with a default amount of memory.  We need to change JVM_OPTS to use -Xms & -Xmx.

Currently, importing data causes an out of memory error.

I imagine -Xms128m -Xmx256m would be appropriate.
fields.summary: Change standalone version to use more memory

fields.description:
It should be possible to make not public comments on http://jira.atlassian.com/. Today you can only choose between "All users" and "Jira users".

It should be possible to select "Jira developers". This can be uefull if you want to post urls to your own jitainstallation that you don't want to post in public.
fields.summary: It should be possible to make not public comments on http://jira.atlassian.com/

fields.summary: Internal Exception

fields.description: Priority is sorted from trivial (top-most) to blocker (bottom-most). Should be the other way.
fields.summary: Roadmap: Wrong sorting on priority.

fields.description:
When I add custom date field, there is no possibility to define date format. It must be always "dd-mm-yyyy", but I want "dd.mm.yyyy". What if I want "yyyy.mm.dd"???
Maybe there can be global setting for all date fields.
fields.summary: Custom date format

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1290].
  {panel}

We really need to be able to customise the report output. 
In particular we would like to able to see the linked issues. But by making it flexible we can create any report that we need.

Cheers,
g
fields.summary: customisable report output

fields.description:
Hi,
we have some projects that are linked. It would be great if we could report on them as a group. Is there any way to do this? What would be nice is a pick list on the 'find issues' screen instead of a combo - that way we could select multiple projects to report on, then save it as a filter for the more general project.

Thx
g
fields.summary: select multiple projects to report on

fields.description: Log error message and move on.
fields.summary: OfbizJobStore should not die when 'dudgy' triggers are loaded :)

fields.description:
At the top of each issue, under the issue title, you have the UPDATED and CREATED fields with their dates.

When a user adds a comment, we see the date _and the time_ the comment was added.

Would like to see the time added to the updated and created fields at the top of the issue.
fields.summary: Show updated/created time on view issue header

fields.description: When you delete a comment you get an error
fields.summary: Error when deleting comments

fields.description: And any other colums that we haven't included yet, like time worked.
fields.summary: XML and excel view should contain custom columns

fields.description: If you try to resolve an issue, and choose the "none" fixfor value, you get an error.
fields.summary: Cannot Resolve issue with "None" fixfor value

fields.description:
When you first enter the dashboard, you have to click a button to say "enable dashboard configuration".

Would like a similar button to do the reverse -- remove all of my dashboard settings, and use the default again.  (Is the "default" the admin's settings?)
fields.summary: "Restore Defaults" feature for dashboard

fields.description:
I logged in as our admin, and customized the dashboard.  Looks like doing this forces the change on all users?  I went to another one of our user's PCs and she saw all of the changes I had made.  (She likely had not yet customized herself.)

Anyway, I then logged in with my user account, and also customized.  When I return to the homepage, I am now constantly getting an exception:

org.apache.jasper.JasperException
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServletWrapper.service(JspServletWrapper.java:248)
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.serviceJspFile(JspServlet.java:289)
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.service(JspServlet.java:240)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:853)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationDispatcher.invoke(ApplicationDispatcher.java:684)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationDispatcher.doForward(ApplicationDispatcher.java:432)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationDispatcher.forward(ApplicationDispatcher.java:356)

I had "remember my login" enabled.  If I shut down the browser, and return, I continue to get this error.  If I delete my cookie, I then see the login page.  But the second I login, I get the error again.  Looks like I somehow corrupted my account!
fields.summary: Customizing dashboard as admin, overwrites user settings

fields.description:
While viewing http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=JRA-1276, I decided to check the Change History and Workflow history. I was not logged in, and I received the following error message:

--- BEGIN erromsg ---
Error

The issue key or ID that you entered does not exist in the system.
Please check the key or ID you entered.
View Issue #:  JRA-1276;jsessionid=CPNMBDBDCJHB [View]
(issue keys usually look like FOO-52)
--- END errormsg ---

Note that the sessionid is incorrectly appended to the issue #. This error does not exist when a user is logged in.
fields.summary: Change/Workflow History generates invalid error msg when not logged in

fields.description:
It would be very helpful if users could "start progress" on issues for which they are not the assignee, and if doing so automatically reassigned the issue to the user.

To take an issue from someone else and atart progress on it currently takes five steps (five user operations, four page loads):
1) find issue
2) click "assign"
3) select self
4) submit
5) click "start progress"

This process, very frequently used in my group, could be streamlined to two steps (two user operations, two page loads):
1) find issue
2) click "start progress"
fields.summary: "Start progress" and auto-assign to self bugs/issues that are assigned to others in one click

fields.description:
If you are using email notification and a connection to the Email Server is down when sending occurs, then the emails are lost.

Debug info in the TomCat server says sending failed but no re-try is ever activated.  All email notifications that had an error during send should be queued again until a successful notification occurs.
fields.summary: Email notification lost when Email Server Connection Down

fields.description:

eg "VALUE", "TRIGGER".

fields.description:
I used a custom logo, that works fine however the preview seems to assume that I'm running on port 80, the default.

I enter the logo path as "images/logo.gif"

The logo is therefore http://server:8080/jira/images/logo.gif

Your images preview assumes http://server/jira/images/logo.gif and therefore doesn't work.

I have set up my base URL as  http://server:8080/jira

-John-

fields.description:
Possible Use Case to reproduce issue, all logged in as admin:

1) Create notification scheme
2) Create project A
3) Apply notification scheme to project A
4) From View Project page, view Project A
5) Click edit notification, no notification scheme name is displayed, and the edit page is completely blank.

Notes: We have two notification schemes.  We have been able to reproduce in different ways.  Although, with two schemes setup, applied to two different projects, the first scheme we setup seems to edit properly through the view project page.

fields.description:
When searching for issues, if I click on the "priority" header of the search results table, issues are sorted from lower priority to higher priority. 
If I want to get them in the "higher priority first" order (which is the case 99% of the time when sorting by priority), I have to click again on the header. 
This slows down a bit navigation through search results.
fields.summary: Priority default sort order should be from higher to lower

fields.description:
We like very much the capability to define filters. However they are only accessible on the homepage (dashboard) and when viewing a filter report. But it takes at least 2 clicks before a predefined filter can be invoked.

We suggest to show a show dropdown box with filters in the menubar. For example just before VIEW ISSUE # on the right site of the menubar. This then is available on each JIRA page. If no filters are defined, then do not show anything.
fields.summary: Easy quick access to predefined filters on all JIRA pages

fields.description: I think I found a filtering bug in JIRA but I apparently don't have an account on your server to report it.  We have version 1.4.2-#22 but I also found it on your site (jira.atlassian.com).  If I filter with an incorrect user login, all the rest of the filter settings are lost because they revert to those of the previous search.  If I choose to "View and Hide," I will not even see the error message at all, but I will see the results of the previous search, which therefore could be mistaken for the results of the current filter.

fields.description:
To attach a screen shot a JIRA incident, you currently have to use a program such as SnagIt or PhotoShop to store the screen shot to a file and then you have to upload it as an attachment.

It would be much easier if jira embeded that functionality via an applet.  All you would have to do is screen shot window you are on via the built in Alt-PrintScreen key.  Go to the Jira page with the screenshot upload applet.  And then have the applet get the screenshot from the clipboard and upload it to the server.
fields.summary: Provide a way to attach screen shots into an incident easier.

fields.description:
At first I added an export service, configured to export every 1440 minutes (1 day = (* 24 60) minutes).  Then I added another service (FileService) with a delay of 1 minute.

At one point jira was not picking up my latest changes to the handler I associated with the file service; so I deleted the file service and re-added it.  It was still using the previous version of my handler.  Then I changed the name of my handler class (both in the source code, in the file system in WEB-INF/classes/... and in the service's "handler" property).  It then began using my latest version of the handler.

After I had completed hookup of my modified handler with my homegrown CVS mail notification, I decided to rename the handler so it would have the original (meaningful) name I first gave... jira reverted to using previous version of the handler...

I then looked into the directory where the export service is depositing export files : instead of having only one file (because last one have been generated less than a day ago), there were multiple files !  Many of them were generated at 1 minute interval, other at 5 minutes interval...corresponding to the changes of delay I made on the file service (i.e. the other service)... !

Note: It may be another manifestation of caching bug described at JRA-1201.
fields.summary: Removing and re-adding services leads to erratic behavior

fields.description:
It should be possible to configure the type of select box: one choice or multiple choices.

Use case: track which feature is reported by which customer, so we can create feature request overviews per customer. Therefore one must be able to select and/or deselect multiple items from a list box.
fields.summary: Allow multiple select for custom fields

fields.description:
Currently you can manually add items to a custom field selection list. 
It should be possible to use external data sources for these items. 

An example is to have a custom field with a dropdown box where we can select a customer id. The master list of customer ids comes from an external CRM system. There are many of these examples possible, e.g. project codes etc..
fields.summary: Use external source for custom field selection list

fields.description:
I get a:
"ERROR [event.listeners.mail.MailListener] You must specify an SMTP server (email.server) or JNDI location for a mail session (email.session) in the parameters."

And no mails are sent.

I have setup the resource in tomcat like this in server.xml:
<Resource name="mail/Session" auth="Container" type="javax.mail.Session"/>
     <ResourceParams name="mail/Session">
     <parameter>
...
     </parameter>
     </ResourceParams>

And it has been added to the web.xml for jira:
<resource-ref>
        <res-ref-name>mail/Session </res-ref-name>
        <res-type>javax.mail.Session</res-type>
        <res-auth> Container </res-auth>
</resource-ref>

I the jira edit listener I have specified email.from, email.session (set to mail/Session) and subject.prefix.

What have I done wrong?

Cheers

Thomas
fields.summary: Mail session not picked up from Tomcat resource definition

fields.description:
We have a few projects that are always referred to as being all lowercase.  When these are shown on the dashboard, all projects with a capital letter are sorted alpha first, then all lower case projects sorted alpha.  (Sorting by ASCII value?)

So our project with a lowercase title of, say, "demowebsite.com" actually comes up waaaaay on the bottom of the list.

So we'd like the project list to sort alphabetically, but ignore case.  I presume this would be similar for the "All Projects" portlet in 2.0RC1.
fields.summary: Sort the project list on dashboard alphabetically, ignoring case

fields.description:
I want to assign something to "Mike" but have "Scott" watch it and get all the updates.

Another variation -- I want "Mike" and "Scott" to both do something but I don't want to have to create seperate issues for each. (Though the tool could create two seperate issues for tracking)


A final variation -- I want "Mike" and "Scott" to do something weekly/daily/monthly and get the issue "scheduled"
fields.summary: Allow issue creator to assign AND add watchers explicitly

fields.description:
It would be helpful if an issues owner or assignee could enter an email address to be added to the watch list for an issue. An example use case is:

1. Help desk receives an issue from joe@blow.com.
2. Help desk enters the issue into JIRA on behalf of Joe Blow.
3. joe@blow.com is added to the issue's watch list, preferably during issue creation.
4. Joe receives an email regarding the creation of his new issue.
5. Any modifications to the issue are also emailed to Joe.

It would be more convenient if Joe did not have to be a "registered" user in the system.
fields.summary: Manually edit an issue's watch list
